Articles.Content: okay, but rss is too buggy and crashy for me now, i will try it later, thanks anyways

okay, but rss is too buggy and crashy for me now, i will try it later, thanks anyways

Edited June 2, 2016 by nablabla

And how can you be sure that RSS is responsible of your crash?

First, RSS+RVE is very memory consumer, so in function of your config, you may be able or not to play with these mod. What are your installed RAM and VRAM on your config?
Then, did you use CKAN to install you mod? Installing your mod manually can easily lead you to errors.
Last, If you want help to fix your errors, you should post your logs, on pastebin eg.
Very nice job
Has anyone got the terrain textures to work in 1.1.2? (the ones in RVE/EVE/Terrain), or is that just not working anymore?
Thank you all for answers, Reading through the comments I managed to work RSS Visual Enhancments (RVE) for KSP 1.1.2. I used {AnyCPU-EVE-Release 1.1-2}+{RVE-KSP-1.0.4-Linux64} D3D11 doing great.
Hi, when clouds pass the are sometimes very low looks like fog! How can I change the distance of the clouds and the ground ?

2 hours ago, nanokarlo said:

 

Hi, when clouds pass the are sometimes very low looks like fog! How can I change the distance of the clouds and the ground ?

 
 

Open Alt+O (Alt-"Zero") for EVE GUI and go to CloudsManager, then look for "Altitude" in the Earth-Clouds-Main tab. Change it to 3500 or so instead of 2000. Then hit apply and save. I can get some screens if you need later

So I don't put in the BoulderCo folder from AnyCPU-Configs-Release? cause i'm currently getting no clouds, still trying to figure out what i'm doing wrong.

 

I installed the base AnyCPU-EVE-Release, then AnyCPU-Configs-Release, finally RVE-KSP-1.0.4-Linux64, now clouds from a CKAN install of RSS and RO.

1 hour ago, fanelli said:

So I don't put in the BoulderCo folder from AnyCPU-Configs-Release? cause i'm currently getting no clouds, still trying to figure out what i'm doing wrong.

I installed the base AnyCPU-EVE-Release, then AnyCPU-Configs-Release, finally RVE-KSP-1.0.4-Linux64, now clouds from a CKAN install of RSS and RO.

No.  The "GameData/BoulderCo/" directory tree is EVE's default config, from "AnyCPU-Configs-Release.zip".  That will conflict with RVE.  RVE provides all the configs.

I suggest clearing out all of EVE, Scatterer, and RVE and starting again.  Removed "GameData/EnvironmentalVisualEffects/", "GameData/BoulderCo/", "GameData/scatterer/", and "GameData/RVE/"

Follow @Rhavoreth's procedure for installing RVE for KSP 1.1.2:

In other words:

1. Get the latest version of EVE, and EVE only (ie. the plugins and shaders), which is in the archive "AnyCPU-EVE-Release.zip".

2. Get the latest version of Scatterer.

3. Get the latest version of RVE for the Linux64 branch, which is the active branch under development.  On that page, click the green "Clone or Download" button and then click "Download ZIp".  If you're not running KSP 64-bit or have a limited amount of memroy, you may have issues with the amount of  memory use.

While you're at it, you should rename the EVE and RVE download ZIP's to include their version numbers, or just tag them with the date (add in a YYYYMMDD string like 20160606a to their names).

4.  Install the contents of all three zips, but only the directory "RVE" from RVE.  You should now have the directory trees "GameData/EnvironmentalVisualEffects/", "GameData/scatterer/", and "GameData/RVE/".

If you're still having issues, please provide some screenshots and your logs as described here.

 

Edited June 6, 2016 by Jacke

Wow! Thanks for the awesome, nicely summarized update, here! I was just on the way to catastrophe having used only the link from the first page...

Question about the images on the first page, though; what part-mods is that "Spacestation 16" using in that imgur album? I noticed some very nice-looking ISS-like modules.

 

Well, darn it!

I'm playing KSP to explore stuff in space - land on the moon, then move on to Mars and the Galilean moons of Jupiter, and even drop by Titan - but this is making Earth so spectacularly beautiful you're going to make me spend a tremendous amount of time making airplanes and flying around the planet instead of leaving it!

 

Spectacular job.

Btw, I think setting the atmosphere's scale to 50% on Scatterer makes it the most realistic looking. Flying at 30-50,000 feet in an airplane, I can take a picture with my phone and it looks like I'm in space - it even kind of looks like it to my eye, hah. The sky gets dark and atmosphere's haze drops low really fast. By 70,000 feet, sky should be pitch black and pretty low, yet on the default settings it looks like I'm at 70,000 feet when I'm at 200 km

Not really complaining, though, it was pretty easy to fix once I figured out Scatterer's F10 gui configs. Also, way less buggy and more stable than earlier versions. That's definitely come a very long way. Grats

 

 

Btw, are there any configs for the rest of the solar system yet? I think I'd actually have a good deal of fun making them, if there aren't. Name the folder after the body, set up Scatterer's config to include the planet - it didn't take that long to figure out Earth's. I could probably do the rest of the atmosphered bodies over the next few weeks if that would help (taking summer courses), and see if you like the product.

I'm really shocked that Scatterer's config tool seems to naturally make sunsets/sunrises over Mars blue... Wow. I guess calculating things accurately are how it makes Earth so breathtaking, so it's only natural it would be accurate on Mars, but still, wow.

Edited June 7, 2016 by Comet Tail

Can't speak for the dev, but I would love this.

@Comet Taili made some scaterrer configs for Venus, Jupiter and Uranus (Saturn is a difficult one because the oblation that was implemented in RSS a few versions ago breaks all of the beatification mods). I would suggest to download the the Scatterer Config Tool. Once you get the hang of it it is easy to make any scaterrer config you like (you want a pink planet? you got it!)

IS this suppose to work with RSS in1.1.2 Because I see people on youtube with RSS and clouds in 1,1,2 yet when I install this it doesn't work. I'm a little bit confused, I'm probably doing something wrong. But i'm used to installing mods it's no big deal I get all the other mods to work except clouds for rss..... help?

4 hours ago, Dermeister said:

IS this suppose to work with RSS in1.1.2 Because I see people on youtube with RSS and clouds in 1,1,2 yet when I install this it doesn't work. I'm a little bit confused, I'm probably doing something wrong. But i'm used to installing mods it's no big deal I get all the other mods to work except clouds for rss..... help?

PlanetShine-Scattering and distant object enhancement are installed using Ckan. The RSS Visual Enhancements (RVE) must be installed manual. https://github.com/rbray89/EnvironmentalVisualEnhancements/releases/tag/EVE-1.1-2-1

https://github.com/Pingopete/RVE-KSP-1.0.4/tree/Linux64

first install PlanetShine-Scattering and distant object enhancement,and then these 2 files,and replace files when asks

It's all just delete all of the prior install.

If you mean the main menu screen by saying "starting up ksp" - don't worry, open your save and it should be all working inside the flight scene / tracking station.
